where we answer your personal questions
the question for this week is my boss is

please him I feel like I am going crazy
I can't quit my job due to financial
stuff
how can I keep my cool at work
is getting to the point that I hate
going to work in the morning
I always feel that anyone that feels
trapped
is in big trouble
to make a statement that you must hold
his job
since when it's true you may be
concerned that you may not get an
alternative job but you have to always
open the possibility that maybe you
shouldn't be in this place
because it may be too debilitating
and maybe it's time to start exploring
some people feel they're stuck in their
situation when they're really not stuck
so that's Point number one
Point number two let's assume you can't
find another job and this is where
you're stuck
being stuck remember comes with
consequences
because being stuck means that you
suddenly have to compromise and do
things you would not do things that can
end up hurting yourself
that's why I go back to point number one
that you have to always look for
Alternatives you never want to be in a
place where you're a victim
that being said
let's address the situation under the
circumstances
a boss is a tyrant means you're
dependent on him you can't get around
him
but however maybe it's possible
in a way to find someone else that you
answer to that's not directly to the
boss I'm just giving you some innovative
ways sometimes you could find some way
to buffer it if that's not possible then
at the end of the day you're going to
have to find Alternatives outside of
work that give you some satisfaction you
know you hate going to work every
morning that's a doomed place I don't
see how you could start loving it when
you have a voice that you're constantly
terrified of you can try to change your
attitude and smile about it but then the
day you're being oppressed
now I want to add that often we allow
ourselves to be victims the boss may be
a tyrant but is he picking only on you
does he picking on everybody are you
doing anything that feeds into it you
have to wonder
but regardless to stay stuck and remain
a victim and just say I'm just going to
bite the bullet it's not healthy for
anyone it's going to have to give at
some point you're going to become
extremely resentful
now if you have a husband if you have a
wife if you have somebody that you can
speak to a friend they may be able to be
helpful to look at the situation and
what would they do
maybe you are tolerating too much
there's a point as I said at the outset
that a person has to say enough is
enough and tolerating too much abuse is
not necessarily a healthy thing
yes money is a factor but money is not
everything life and health is even more
important
so I wish you well I wish you the
strength to make the right decision the
decision whether to leave or the
decision to stay but stay with strength
and find ways to buffer it find ways to
diffuse it find ways to distract
yourself whatever it takes but don't
